message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DB, cs.SE, cs.CL. 

The paper discusses the problem of automating the acquisition of rules for the Semantic Web, which involves knowledge representation, reasoning, and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), which covers topics related to intelligent agents, knowledge representation and reasoning, and machine learning. The paper also mentions Inductive Logic Programming, which is a subfield of machine learning, supporting the inclusion of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as a likely sub-category. The use of ontologies and hybrid knowledge representation and reasoning systems suggests cs.DB (Databases) and cs.SE (Software Engineering) as possible sub-categories. Finally, the paper also discusses natural language processing, which falls under cs.CL (Computation and Language).
